title: 103_hr2480
content: Section 116 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 excludes dividends and interest received by individuals from gross income. The Internal Revenue Code excludes dividends and interest received by individuals from gross income. Certain dividends from tax-exempt corporations are also excluded. Special rules apply to distributions from regulated investment companies and real estate investment trusts. The Internal Revenue Code excludes dividends and interest from gross income for individuals. Special rules apply to distributions from regulated investment companies and real estate investment trusts. Nonresident alien individuals are subject to certain limitations on exclusion. The Internal Revenue Code excludes dividends and interest from gross income for individuals, with special rules for distributions from regulated investment companies and real estate investment trusts. Nonresident alien individuals are subject to limitations on exclusion. Amendments are made to the table of sections for part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Code. Amendments are made to sections 265(a), 584, and 643 of the Internal Revenue Code regarding the exclusion of dividends and interest received by individuals. Participants in common trust funds are considered to have received their proportionate share of dividends or interest under section 116. Amendments to sections 643 and 854 of the Internal Revenue Code include the inclusion of dividends or interest excluded from gross income under section 116. Dividends received from regulated investment companies meeting certain requirements are treated as dividends for tax purposes. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code include the treatment of dividends and interest received by regulated investment companies. If dividends and interest equal or exceed 75% of gross income, they are treated as dividends. Otherwise, a portion is treated as interest based on the company's income composition. Gross income and interest received are adjusted by deductions allowable under section 163. Shareholders are notified of the amounts received. The regulated investment company must notify shareholders of the designated amount of distributions that can be considered as dividends for exclusion purposes. Gross income excludes stock or securities gains, and aggregate dividends received only include dividends from domestic corporations. For exclusion purposes, dividends received from a real estate investment trust meeting certain requirements are not considered as dividends under section 116 and section 243 of the Code. Dividends from a real estate investment trust meeting specific requirements are treated as interest if the trust's aggregate interest income equals or exceeds 75% of its gross income. If not, a portion of the dividend is treated as interest based on the ratio of interest income to gross income. Gross income excludes net capital gain for these purposes. For a real estate investment trust, gross income excludes net capital gain. Gross income and aggregate interest received are reduced by allowable deductions under section 163. Gross income is further reduced by certain taxes imposed by section 857(b). Distributions by the trust designated as interest for exclusion under section 116 are limited. The amendments made by this section regarding the limitation on distributions under section 116 apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1993.
